What steps has the Verus community taken to ensure the security of their Discord server, and how can users verify the authenticity of messages and files using VerusID?

The Verus community has taken steps to harden their Discord server security to prevent future attacks. They have also explored ways to leverage VerusID to enhance security in meaningful ways. Specifically, they are looking for people with experience in writing Discord bots and securing servers to help with this effort.

In addition, the Verus community has developed a way to verify the authenticity of messages and files using VerusID. This is done by signing the message or file with a unique signature that can be verified on any Verus node or lite mode API. Users can copy the message or file, enter the ID and signature, and check if the signature is valid. This ensures that the message or file has not been tampered with and is indeed from the claimed sender.

The Verus website also provides an interface to verify signed files, messages, and hashes, making it easy for users to check the authenticity of messages and files. This feature is an example of how VerusID can be used to provide an additional layer of security and trust in online communications.
